resources.string: Measures the acceleration force in m/s<small><sup>2</sup></small> that is applied to a device on all three physical axes (x, y, and z), including the force of gravity.
Measures the signal strengh of the CDMA network.
Records latitude and altitude from the device\'s GPS.
Measures the force of gravity in m/s<small><sup>2</sup></small> that is applied to a device on all three physical axes (x, y, z).
Measures the signal strengh of the GSM network.
Measures a device\'s rate of rotation in rad/s around each of the three physical axes (x, y, and z).

Measures a device\'s rate of rotation in rad/s around each of the three physical axes (x, y, and z). In contrast with a calibrated Gyroscope sensor, this sensor does not perform gyro-drift compensation on it values.
Measures the relative ambient humidity in percent (%).
Measures the acceleration force in m/s<small><sup>2</sup></small> that is applied to a device on all three physical axes (x, y, and z), excluding the force of gravity.
Measures the ambient light level (illumination) in lx.
Measures the ambient geomagnetic field for all three physical axes (x, y, z) in μT.

Measures the geomagnetic field for all three physical axes (x, y, z) in μT. In contrast with a calibrated Magnetic field sensor, distortions on the magnetic field produced by the device are not taken into account by this sensor.
Measures degrees of rotation that a device makes around all three physical axes (x, y, z).
Measures the ambient air pressure in hPa or mbar.
Measures the proximity of an object in cm relative to the view screen of a device.
This sensor triggers and event when a significant motion on the device is detected.
Measures the orientation of a device by providing the three elements of the device\'s rotation vector.

Measures the orientation of a device by providing the three elements of the device\'s rotation vector. In contrast with a Rotation sensor, this sensor does not use the use the geomagnetic field. As a result, the orientation values may drift over time.

Measures the orientation of a device by providing the three elements of the device\'s rotation vector. This sensor uses a magnetometer instead of a gyroscope. As a result, this sensor uses lower power than the other rotation vectors. However, it is more noisy and will work best outdoors.
Measures the ambient sound level in dB.
Measures the number of steps taken by the user since the last reboot while activated.
This sensor triggers an event each time a step is taken by the user.
Measures the ambient room temperature in degrees Celsius (°C).
